description: The Thing Protocol Response is sent in response to a command.
title: Thing Protocol Response

correlation-id.description: The correlation-id header is used for linking one message with another. It typically links a reply message with its requesting message.

version.description: Determines the version of the *Things* payload.

path.description:
A Path that references a part of a Thing which is affected by this message.
Examples:
 * `/feature/location/properties/longitude` (a single sensor value)
 * `/` (the whole Thing)

value.description: The _value_ field contains the actual payload e.g. a sensor value. The content must follow the *Things Model Schema*.

status.description: The status code that indicate the result of the command. The semantics of the used status codes are based on the [HTTP status codes](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6).
